page.title: 04FARMING IN DOLPHINTON AREA
page.content: One farm in Dolphinton is wholly let as grazing, as a result has no machinery. 6 farms have 2 tractors, 1 has 4 and 1 has 1. 5 own a combine and 3 hire contractors to harvest the grain. 3 own a silorator and 3 hire contractors to cut their silage. 5 farms use outside contractors for tasks like lime-spreading, sheep shearing, turnipp-shawing and sowing barley or grass-seed. Lanour on the farms comprises, as well as the farmers:- 9 other family members, 3 permanent workers, 4 part-time or casual workers. 2 of the farms are owner occupied, 8 are rented, 7 of them from the Mackenzie family of Dolphinton Estate, (which is presently for sale). The Estate also owns all the woodland in Dolphinton. None of the farmers belong to the National Farmers Union.
